text: we we have partnered with a number of
universities here in the city we have a
strong partnership with cuni with NYU
with Columbia we're now opening a math
science School uh on the new Columbia
campus with Columbia in which their
professors are going to be working with
our kids and a lot of kids from Harlem
and from uh Northern Manhattan who will
going to this school as well as kids
throughout the city so I think there're
are real Partnerships the other thing
that I've been saying uh and we're
getting some success on is you got to
transform our educational schools our
educational schools have got to do a
much better job in two areas one is in
the whole area of classroom management
and the challenges that teachers will
face in high needs communities the
issues we talked about before of kids
who come to school with very challenged
backgrounds and difficult circumstance
and our teachers need to learn as part
of their ed school experience how to
deal with that it's got to be much more
clinical much more Hands-On and second
of all we've got to create Partnerships
between the ed schools and the schools
of arts and sciences so that content
becomes a big part of your educational
training pedagogy matters how you teach
what the methodology is that matters but
content also matters a great pedagogue
who doesn't know math cannot teach math
and we've got to get real Partnerships
going on we recently started a program
actually with Kip Achievement First and
uncommon schools and Hunter and they
have a new Ed school dean there who is
really terrific in my view willing to
reconfigure the way teacher preparation
is done those are valuable valuable
years that we need to rethink and rework
on the other thing I think that the
institutions of higher education need to
be doing is again helping us get kids on
track for science technology earlier on
and they could be doing things with
Summer internships and programs and
getting kids into the campus at an
earlier age
